title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #214: Unit Distance Free Sets and Unit Squares**

If S ⊂ ℝ² has no two points at distance 1, must Sᶜ contain a unit square?

**Answer:** YES (Juhász, 1979)

**Stronger result:** Sᶜ contains a congruent copy of ANY 4-point set.
mathContext: Unit-distance-free sets avoid a single distance. This forces their complements to be geometrically rich.

title: IsUnitDistanceFree
content:
**Unit-Distance-Free Set:**

A set S is unit-distance-free if no two distinct points in S are exactly distance 1 apart.

∀ p, q ∈ S, p ≠ q → ‖p - q‖ ≠ 1

title: IsUnitSquare
content:
**Unit Square:**

Four points form a unit square if:
- All four edges have length 1
- Both diagonals have length √2

This is a regular square with side length 1.

title: Erdos214Statement
content:
**Main Statement:**

∀ S ⊂ ℝ², if S is unit-distance-free, then Sᶜ contains four points forming a unit square.

The complement must be rich enough to contain this specific configuration.

title: Juhász's Theorem (1979)
content:
**Juhász's Theorem:**

The statement Erdos214Statement is true.

Published in 'Ramsey type theorems in the plane' (1979).

title: Juhász's Stronger Theorem
content:
**Stronger Result:**

If S is unit-distance-free, then Sᶜ contains a congruent copy of ANY 4-point configuration.

Unit squares are just one special case!

title: Fails for Large Sets
content:
**Limitation:**

The property does NOT hold for arbitrarily large point sets.

For some n, there exists a unit-distance-free S whose complement avoids some n-point configuration.

title: 5-Point Case is Open
content:
**Open Question:**

Does the property hold for all 5-point configurations?

We know it works for 4 points, fails for large n. The 5-point case is unknown.

title: Chromatic Number Connection
content:
**Connection to Chromatic Number:**

The chromatic number χ(ℝ²) is between 5 and 7 (de Grey, 2018).

This is the minimum colors needed to color the plane with no two distance-1 points sharing a color. Each color class is unit-distance-free.

title: Summary
content:
**Erdős Problem #214: SOLVED (Juhász, 1979)**

**Problem:** Unit-distance-free S ⟹ Sᶜ contains unit square?

**Answer:** YES - and more generally, any 4-point configuration

**Limitation:** Fails for sufficiently large point sets

**Open:** Does it hold for 5-point configurations?
